GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 19, 2025
Lisa Ann Jackson Sutton
Anderson Life Development Center
8017 Ohio St,
Detroit, MI, 48204-3235
RE: License#: CB821001419
Dear Lisa Ann Jackson Sutton:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 5/16/2025. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Lonia Perry Calloway, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
R400.12504(3) Eligibility requirements:
The agency was provided information related to safe sleep matters it shall utilize
with youths that are in the host home who have infants or toddlers; or who may be
placed in this independent living home and who may have a young child.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
R400.12505(2)(b) Supervision:
The agency was provided advice related to safety features, and repairs that can
occur related to a storage closet, an entrance door, and space heating equipment
if/when used by a youth.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The agency submitted a chief administrator (CA) report dated 4/4/2025 and signed
5/1/2025. The CA report indicated the agency has no youths in care at this time;
and the agency is in the process of obtaining a contract with the department.
During a discussion with the agency administrators related to this matter, the CA
reported the delay or barrier around the contract being obtained relates to them
obtaining the insurance that is required. The CA reported they have narrowed
down possible insurance providers, and they should have the insurance needed
within the next 30 days.
Financial Overview
During its original licensing process, the agency submitted a projected budget.
There has been no changes with that budget in the five months that has passed
since the original licensure.
The agency has no placements at this time; and they are still pursuing an
independent living contract with the department which will generate new revenue.
Staff and Youth Interviews
The chief administrator and licensee designee both reported being excited about
getting the program up and running; and getting independent living youth placed
within the program. They seemed proud of the work they have put in on the
program and look forward to making the program something folks can be proud of.
They shared the case manager they have hired, currently is in voluntary status;
and once they obtain the independent living contract and receive youth
placements, this staff person can be a full-time paid staff. I also spoke with this
staff person, and she voiced positives about the agency, what she sees as her
potential role/duties. She also reported that she enjoys working with the youths
who are in the host home.
No negative concerns were noted by either of these three people.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the facility was completed and it showed no major safety
concerns. The agency has sufficient space and equipment, and it has its
employee and youth files stored securely. As mentioned earlier in this report the
agency was provided consultation related to a couple of household matters.

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
This is not applicable. This is a new independent living program.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
May 16, 2025
_____________________________________
Lonia Perry Calloway Date
Licensing Consultant
